titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B58
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B58

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[… …] the tribe of Ḥāshid in the town of […] concerning the tr[ibe] 2.of Ḥimyar; and he commanded 200 fighting men and undertook raids 3.in the land of Ḥimyar, and there he killed one military leader. And (they expressed gratitude to the god Taʾlab) beca[use] 4.he commanded 150 fighting men against Murād 5.[in] the land of ʾAlhān and took captive two military leaders; and [be-] 6.[cause] they [con]fronted an army in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one 7.[mili]tary leader; and because they did battle with the Ethiopians in the region of [..] 8.[.] and he killed therein one military leader; and because he commanded a support [column] 9.[.. A]rabs--110 fighting men--and they did battle wi[th] 10.Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader; and because his [lo]rds 11.of the lineage of Hamdān gave [him] a gift of their horses […] their […] 12.then he killed two panthers and all that […] on this [stele] 13.on which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir has documented the suppression of 14.Dhū-Khaṭilam; and because Taʾlab has granted him the birth 15.[of ma]ny male children. And may Ta[ʾla]b continue to grant them 16.the esteem and good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān 17.[and] their [tri]be of Ḥāshid as well as good crops in 18.[their fields] and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them 19.against the harm and enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyā[mu]m, Lord 20.of Raḥbān.

… … the tribe of Ḥāshid in the town of … concerning the tribe
of Ḥimyar; and he commanded
fighting men and undertook raids
in the land of Ḥimyar, and there he killed one military leader. And they expressed gratitude to the god Taʾlab because
he commanded
fighting men against Murād
in the land of ʾAlhān and took captive two military leaders; and be-
cause they confronted an army in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one
military leader; and because they did battle with the Ethiopians in the region of ..
. and he killed therein one military leader; and because he commanded a support column
.. Arabs--
fighting men--and they did battle with
Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader; and because his lords
of the lineage of Hamdān gave him a gift of their horses … their …
then he killed two panthers and all that … on this stele
on which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir has documented the suppression of
Dhū-Khaṭilam; and because Taʾlab has granted him the birth
of many male children. And may Taʾlab continue to grant them
the esteem and good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān
and their tribe of Ḥāshid as well as good crops in
their fields and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them
against the harm and enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord
of Raḥbān.

… … the tribe of Ḥāshid in the town of … concerning the tribe
of Ḥimyar; and he commanded
fighting men and undertook raids
in the land of Ḥimyar, and there he killed one military leader. And they expressed gratitude to the god Taʾlab because
he commanded
fighting men against Murād
in the land of ʾAlhān and took captive two military leaders; and be-
cause they confronted an army in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one
military leader; and because they did battle with the Ethiopians in the region of ..
. and he killed therein one military leader; and because he commanded a support column
.. Arabs--
fighting men--and they did battle with
Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader; and because his lords
of the lineage of Hamdān gave him a gift of their horses … their …
then he killed two panthers and all that … on this stele
on which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir has documented the suppression of
Dhū-Khaṭilam; and because Taʾlab has granted him the birth
of many male children. And may Taʾlab continue to grant them
the esteem and good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān
and their tribe of Ḥāshid as well as good crops in
their fields and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them
against the harm and enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord
of Raḥbān.

… … the tribe of Ḥāshid in the town of … concerning the tribe
of Ḥimyar; and he commanded
fighting men and undertook raids
in the land of Ḥimyar, and there he killed one military leader. And they expressed gratitude to the god Taʾlab because
he commanded
fighting men against Murād
in the land of ʾAlhān and took captive two military leaders; and be-
cause they confronted an army in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one
military leader; and because they did battle with the Ethiopians in the region of ..
. and he killed therein one military leader; and because he commanded a support column
.. Arabs--
fighting men--and they did battle with
Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader; and because his lords
of the lineage of Hamdān gave him a gift of their horses … their …
then he killed two panthers and all that … on this stele
on which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir has documented the suppression of
Dhū-Khaṭilam; and because Taʾlab has granted him the birth
of many male children. And may Taʾlab continue to grant them
the esteem and good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān
and their tribe of Ḥāshid as well as good crops in
their fields and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them
against the harm and enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord
of Raḥbān.
